title.narrative: Strengthening community security and prevention of violence against women in Tajikistan

description.narrative: The project is designed to contribute to the reduction of domestic violence (DV) against women and girls in three target districts of Tajikistan by: (a) strengthening the identification of, and response to, DV cases (through supporting the coordination and monitoring of police reform processes; bolstering community policing and the capacity of community policing partnership teams (CPPTs); providing conflict and gender sensitivity training to the police, CPPTs and gender-based violence (GBV) service providers; raising awareness on DV and GBV at community levels; and increasing access to GBV services through referral mechanisms) and (b) enabling CPPTs and communities to identify, challenge and address harmful gender norms, behaviours and relationships that perpetuate gender inequality and violence (through participatory conflict and gender analysis (including using Saferworld’s Gender Analysis of Conflict Tookit), gender transformative workshops, and the development and implementation of action plans, resourced through small grants, to challenge, advocate against and address harmful gender norms and behaviours).

title.narrative: 1.1 Policy dialogues and Public Council meetings facilitated to enhance (a) institutional and (b) inter-ministerial coordination in the framework of the ongoing police reform process and submit minutes of the meetings to UNDP
# of national coordination meetings with MIA held throughout the project timeframe

comment.narrative: Target changed from 4 to 2, as it became clear that it would be ineffective to hold more than two national level meetings during the project’s lifetime. UNDP approved change.

By quarter ending 29/02/2020 - 1 national coordination meeting held with the MIA, 46 (5 female, 41 male) participants attended 2 sub-national coordination meeting in Vahdat and Kulob with 66 (29 female, 37 male) participants

title.narrative: # of meeting agendas and minutes developed and shared with all project participants

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 29/02/2020 -1 meeting agenda and minutes developed and shared

title.narrative: 1.2. Expert support provided to the Multi-Disciplinary Working Groups on Prevention of Domestic Violence to identify more cases of domestic violence
# of CPPT members who participate and share their experiences in national coordination meetings

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 29/02/2020 - 12 CPPTs members participated

title.narrative: # of CSO members who participate and share their experiences in national coordination meetings

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 29/02/2020 - 2 CSOs participated in sub-national coordination meetings

title.narrative: % increase in domestic violence cases addressed to Multi-Disciplinary Working Groups on Prevention of Domestic Violence.

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 29/02/2020 - To date 74 (5 male, 69 female) cases of domestic violence have been referred to MDWGs. The overall % increase of cases address by the MDWGs will be reported at the end of the project

title.narrative: 1.5. Small-scale grants provided to women- and youth-led initiatives
# of small grants provided

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 29/02/2020 - 3 small grants provided and implementation of 3 action plans completed

title.narrative: 1.7. Small grants provided to CPPTs on gender-focused issues
# of small grants provided to CPPTs

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 29/02/2020 - 3 small grants provided and implementation of action plans completed.

title.narrative: 1.3. Comprehensive survivor-centered support provided to target districts and meaningful participation of CSOs, local activists, women and youth in support provision strengthened
# of female DV survivors referred

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 29/02/2020

title.narrative: # of DV survivors who reach out to CPPTs referred

comment.narrative: 90 individual referrals (30 in each community)
By quarter ending 29/02/2020

title.narrative: 1.3.1. Focus Group Discussions (FGDs) facilitated to identify key youth groups and their level of activeness in community life and proposals to ensure proactive and meaningful participation of young men and women in community life
# of youth camps held

comment.narrative: 1 youth camp held for 30 young people, including 30% women and 4 CPPT leaders
By quarter ending 31/08/2019 - 1 youth camp for 30 young people (11 female, 19 male); 4 CPPT leaders (all male) also participated at the camp

title.narrative: # of youth camp programmes produced and shared with CPPT members and youth

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 31/08/2019 - 1 youth camp program was developed and shared

title.narrative: # of focus groups discussions (FGD) facilitated with youth

comment.narrative: 4 during the youth camp and 4 in the selected districts

By quarter ending 31/08/2019 - 4 FGDs conducted by Saferworld and our CSO partners before the youth camp to identify and select potential candidate for participation at the camp. Another 4 FGDs conducted after the camp by camp participants, with participation from Saferworld and CSO partners, to discuss and finalize action plans at the community level

title.narrative: # of gender-balanced youth groups formed

comment.narrative: 1 per district
By quarter ending 31/8/2019 - 4 gender-balanced youth groups formed (1 per district)

title.narrative: # of activity reports produced that reflect youth p[perspectives on safety and security

comment.narrative: Y1Q1 - Report to be produced in the next quarter

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 31/08/2019 - 1 gender transformative workshop module developed

title.narrative: # of gender and conflict analysis reports produced that reflect CPPTs and community members’ gender norms, behaviours and relationships

comment.narrative: By quarter ending 31/08/2019 - 3 gender and conflict analysis reports produced that reflect CPPT and community gender norms.

title.narrative: # of one-day workshops on action plan development delivered

comment.narrative: 1 one-day workshop on action plan development delivered to 75 CPPTs members, women and youth groups in selected districts (20 CPPT members and five women and youth leaders in each district)

comment.narrative: 1 two-day workshop on gender transformation delivered to 75 CPPTs members, including women and youth groups in selected districts (20 CPPT members and 5women and youth leaders in each district)
